soundElements.title: Sound Elements
soundElements.description: Details of the auditory aspects of the screenplay, enhancing the atmosphere and emotional impact.

elements.description: **The use of music to enhance the mood or emotion of a scene. Includes both diegetic (source) and non-diegetic (score) music.**

params.description: Details of how the music is used in the scene, including lyrical or instrumental aspects. **In a script, can include song lyrics, or a description of the musical sequence, especially in musical numbers**.

elements.description: **Noises or sounds (SFX) used to create atmosphere or enhance the story, indicated in the audio column of an AV script or by capitalization in the action lines of a screenplay.**

params.description: Specific sounds and the context in which they are used in a scene. **Capitalization in the screenplay action lines can emphasize the impact of a sound effect.**
params.avScriptColumn: If an AV script is being written include which audio column the SFX belongs in.

elements.description: **The spoken words of the characters, including subtext, tone, and any parenthetical performance directions.**

params.dialogue: The exact spoken words of the character.
params.subtext: Underlying meanings or intentions of the dialogue.
params.parenthetical: Performance directions for actors, such as (WHISPERING) or (LAUGHING). **Should be used sparingly to avoid over-directing actors.**

elements.description: **Narration provided by a character or unseen narrator (V.O.), used for exposition or internal monologue. Also included in the audio column of an AV script.**

params.narration: The exact words being spoken as voiceover.
params.purpose: The reason for the voiceover, whether it's exposition, character's thoughts, or scene setting.
params.avScriptColumn: If an AV script is being written include which audio column the V.O. belongs in.
params.extension: Formatted as an extension to a character's dialogue
